x_l: The New York Jets have agreed to terms with free-agent defensive end Sheldon Richardson, a league source told NFL Network Insider Ian Rapoport. Richardson, 26, will sign a three-year deal, a source told Rapoport. The deal is worth up to $45 million, Rapoport reported Saturday. Rapoport added that the Jets will likely sign Richardson as early as Sunday. A first-round pick of the Jets in 2012, Richardson suffered through a disappointing first season in a contract year, but has emerged as a rising star for the Jets in the wake of last year's impressive season.
y_orig: The 6-foot-3, 265-pound Richardson is a strong run defender who can also play in the passing game.
y_summ: Richardson is a versatile defensive end who can play the run and rush the passer.
